creditline: The Suzanne S. Roberts Fund for Asian Art
description: grey, black and white; tower and roof at right, LRQ; large, dark, rolling mountains at center and bottom; waves or clouds at lower center
dimension:
56 x 16 15/16 in. (142.24 x 43.02 cm) (image)
80 x 25 1/2 in. (203.2 x 64.77 cm) (including roller)
inscription:
一旦謝名利　林下忘世囂　請看自然理　春筍入夏高

Poem: Yōsetsu hōshin no. 25
markings: poem UL red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4]; 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LLC, in red: 拙居 {sekkyo}
portfolio: From Landscapes of the Four Seasons
signed: 戊午清和月古道人 {tsuchinoe-uma seiwazuki Kodōjin} (April 1918, Kodōjin)
text:
一旦謝名利　
林下忘世囂　
請看自然理　
春筍入夏高
One day I said goodbye to fame and fortune,
Beneath the forest, forgot all worldly noise.
Please take a look at the Principles of Nature:
Spring bamboo shoots with summer surge up high.
title: Landscape after Mi Fu
